intro: Brachyscome ciliocarpa, commonly known as the woolly star, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its flowers bloom in spring and summer, producing a range of colors from white to pink. Brachyscome ciliocarpa is a low-growing plant, usually reaching heights of less than 30 centimeters.
